SESSION 43第43节第八内在感官,空间
APRIL 13, 1964 9 PM MONDAY AS INSTRUCTED1964年4月13日星期一晚上9点按指示
(While Jane was reading over the 42nd session this morning after breakfast, the word disentanglement came to her mind.This, she believes, is the eighth inner sense, making possible transportation and levitation; Seth has briefly referred to these two being dependent upon another inner sense.(当珍在早餐后读完第42节课时，摆脱纠结disentanglement这个词浮现在她的脑海，她认为这是第八种内在感官，使传输和悬浮成为可能；赛斯简要地提到这两种内在感官依赖于另一种内在感官。
(While napping at about 4:00 PM, for a very brief moment Jane experienced the feeling she has described as infinite blackness, or enlargement.See page 309 [in Volume One of The Early Sessions] It came while she was still awake; she had just relaxed and her eyes were closed.This evening Willy behaved admirably, sleeping through the whole session.It was a warm and windy spring night, very beautiful, and during the session one of the living room windows was open.(在下午4点左右打盹的时候，有一个非常短暂的时刻，珍经历了她所描述过的无限的黑暗，或者说是放大的感觉。当时她尚未睡着，只是闭上眼睛放松身体。这天晚上，威利表现得非常好，整节课一直都在睡觉。这是一个温暖多风非常美丽的春夜，上课时，客厅的一扇窗户是开着的。
(Jane dictated in a voice just a bit stronger than normal; she paced at an average rate, her eyes darkened as usual.She began talking a little faster than she had the two previous sessions.She was nervous as usual before the session began.)(珍传述的声音比平时有力些；踱步节奏均匀，眼睛漆黑如常。比前两节课的说话速度稍快。她像往常一样，在课开始前有些紧张。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.")("晚安，赛斯"。)
This can be for the record or you may delete it.这段可以当成记录，也可以删掉。
("Yes?")("是吗？")
I told Ruburt that he wasn’t pregnant, so now I expect that our sessions will be a little smoother again now that he is relieved of the big question.I must say that his discipline was admirable, and that I myself gave him much aid.The sessions themselves have helped Ruburt develop discipline.我告诉过鲁柏，他没有怀孕，所以我期望我们的课程将再次顺畅一些，因为他已经解除了这个重大问题的困扰。我必须说，他的自律令人钦佩，而我本人也给了他很多帮助。课程本身也帮助了鲁柏培养她的自律。
I am pleased that our practical exercises outside of class so to speak, are coming along so well.For one thing our Ruburt is a Doubting Thomas from way back, and evidence of the inner senses that are experienced outside of our sessions help along these lines.I do not want gullible ninnies, however I certainly would enjoy being taken at my word occasionally.Though the shock might be too much for even my constitution.我很高兴你们的课外练习，可以说进展的非常好。一方面，我们的鲁柏一直以来就是一个怀疑主义者)(DoubtingThomas*)，另外，在我们课程之外所经历的内在感官证据，也会在这方面有所帮助。我不想要容易受骗的傻子，但是我说的话偶尔被人听进去，我当然会很高兴。然而以我的组成结构，可能也招架不住这种震撼。
I hope, Joseph, that you will also experience more of the inner senses.You certainly should.我希望，约瑟，你也去体验更多的内在感官。你真的应该。
("How about my dream of the tree branch falling?Any connection there with the inner senses?")("我梦见树枝掉下来的梦境是怎么回事？与内在感官有没有任何关联？")。
The dream of the tree?I do not know if it was merely a dream or not at this point.It was not the same sort of experience as the other you had in connection with a tree.I simply do not know if that particular limb will fall within a specific time.You may have seen its ultimate falling, but this was not the same kind of experience as Ruburt’s seeing the clock.那棵树的梦？此刻我不知道它是否仅仅是一个梦还是不是。它和你另一个与树有关的经历不一样。我只是不知道那个特定的树枝是否会在特定的时间内掉下来。你也许看到它最终掉落下来了，但这和鲁柏看到钟表的经验是不一样的。
Ruburt was right.We shall call the eighth inner sense the sense of disentanglement; and it is one of the most basic inner senses.Complete disentanglement comes rarely on your plane, although it is possible to achieve it with training.Variations occur but usually some remnant of camouflage data is retained.鲁柏是正确的。我们可以把第八种内在感官叫做脱离纠结(disentanglement)的内在感官；它是最基本的内在感官之一。完全脱离伪装在你们的层面很少发生，但通过训练是可能实现的。变化会发生，但通常一些残存的伪装资料仍会被保留下来。
Even here there are gradations.Consider again Ruburt in one room with his eyes closed, "seeing" the time by a clock in the other room.This clairvoyance is of the easier variety, and yet represents an important step in his development, and should in your own.He was concerned with a camouflage idea, that of time, and clock time at that, the clock itself being a camouflage.Clairvoyantly he merely disentangled himself enough to ignore some camouflage in order to perceive camouflage that lay behind it, and this is a necessary first step.即使在这里，也是有渐进梯次的(gradations)。再次想想，鲁柏在一个房间里闭着眼睛，"看见"在另一个房间的钟表上的时间。这种遥视是比较简单的一种，但却代表了他发展中的重要一步，你自己的发展也应该如此。他关注的是一个伪装的概念，是关于时间的概念，而且是钟表的时间，钟表本身是一种伪装。透过遥视，他只是自己脱离纠结(disentangled)到足以)忽视某些伪装，以便感知它背后的伪装，这是必要的第一步。
Even for example, levitation is involved with camouflage to a large degree, in that the camouflage physical body itself rises, but we are still here using the camouflage physical form.Traveling without the camouflage physical form is a giant step, of course, but a possible one according to your development.Here you are traveling however through camouflage space.It is very difficult on your level to do without any camouflage, and yet it can be done; and here again the use of psychological time is extremely important, since when psychological time is utilized to its fullest extent, then camouflage becomes lessened to an almost astounding degree.比如说，甚至悬浮(levitation)也在很大程度上涉及到伪装，因为伪装的躯体本身向上升起，但我们在这里仍然使用伪装的身体形态。没有伪装的身体形态的移动当然是一个巨大的迈进，但根据你们的发展，这是可能的。但这里，你们是在穿越伪装的空间。以你们的层次，不用任何伪装而要做到是非常困难的，但这可以做到，再次地，这里心理时间的运用极其重要，因为当心理时间运用到极致的时候，伪装就会减少到几乎惊人的程度。
(Here, Jane tapped on my desk for emphasis.Her delivery had slowed up somewhat by now, proceeding at the pace of the last two sessions.)(在这里，珍拍了拍我的桌子，以示强调。现在她的语速稍缓，按照前两节课的速度进行。)
I am not going to give you any lessons for levitation, any more than I gave Ruburt lessons in clairvoyance.Your own development and your own rate of assimilation will be the rule, as far as the movement of camouflage objects through camouflage space is concerned.Again, you are dealing with camouflage.You move camouflage objects through the use of your inner senses constantly without your own conscious knowledge.The trick is not to learn how, but to recognize the occurrence, and with practice this is possible.我不会给你们上任何悬浮的课，不会比我在千里眼方面给鲁柏的课还多。就伪装物体在伪装空间中移动而言，你自己的发展和你自己的同化速率(rateofassimilation)将会是准则。再一次，你正在和伪装打交道。你在自己没有意识到的情况下，不断地通过使用你的内在感官在移动伪装对象。诀窍不在于学会怎么)做，而在于认识到发生的情况，通过练习，这是可能的。
I must say that I am somewhat of an old reprobate myself, at least enough to enjoy Ruburt's spring-like attire.Like Ruburt I enjoy the wild wind, and there were many nights when we three walked down spring streets together.我得说，我自己多少有点老朽，至少老朽到很欣赏鲁柏这身春意盎然的打扮。和鲁柏一样我很喜欢狂野的风，有很多个夜晚，我们仨人一起走在春季的街道上。
("In Boston?"("在波士顿吗？"
(I tried to lead Seth on, as I do periodically just for my own amusement.Seth-Jane did not answer my question, as usual; but the superior, you-should-know-better look Jane threw my way made me laugh aloud.)(我试图诱导赛斯，我偶尔为了找乐就会这么做。赛斯-珍像往常一样，没有回答我的问题；不过珍丢给我一副你别傻了的傲慢表情，逗得我大笑。)
In Denmark and in other places.I suggest you take your break before you break me up.在丹麦和其他地方。我建议你在让我崩溃[break]之前，先休息[break]一下吧。
(Break at 9:26.Jane was fairly dissociated.Seth’s reference to wild spring weather probably came because while delivering the above material Jane paused often before the open living room window.It was indeed a beautiful night.(9:26休息。珍相当解离。赛斯说到户外的春天气候，大概是因为在传递上述资料时，珍经常在客厅敞开的窗前停顿下来。这的确是一个美丽的夜晚。
(We discussed some recent dreams we had had; and while doing so Jane stood up and abruptly began dictating again.Her voice was normal, her delivery slow.Resume at 9:30.)(我们讨论了最近做的一些梦，正在说着时，珍突然站起来，又开始传述。她的声音很正常，语速很慢。九)点半继续)。
The universe is expanding in the way that a dream expands.In other words this expansion has nothing to do with your (underline) idea of space.The expansion, in a most basic manner, is more like the expansion of an idea.It has nothing to do with space or time in the manner in which you are accustomed to think of them.I told you earlier that your scientist's idea of an expanding universe was in error, although in one important sense the universe was expanding, and this is what I referred to.宇宙以梦扩展的方式在扩展着。换句话说，这种扩展与你们的空间概念(下划线)无关。扩展，以最基本的方式来说，更像是一个理念(idea)的扩展。它与你们习惯认为的空间或时间无关。我之前告诉过你们，你们的科学家关于宇宙扩展的观点是错误的，但是在一个重要的意义上，宇宙在扩展，这就是我想说的。
(Again Jane rapped on my desk.In the following material I will underline a few of the points of emphasis she made.)(珍再次在我的桌子上拍了拍。在接下来的资料中，我会在她强调的几个重点下面划线。)
Your own dream world expands constantly.Your ideas expand constantly, but your ideas have nothing to do with space, and the manner in which the universe constantly expands has nothing to do with your idea of space.True space, fifth dimensional space, has abilities of expansion that do not need space, not in your terms.你们自己的梦世界不断扩展。你们的思想观念不断扩展，但你们的思想观念与空间无关，而宇宙不断扩展的方式也与你们的空间观念无关。真正的空间，第五维度(fifthdimensional)空间，具有的扩展能力是不需要空间的，不需要你们所说的空间。
There is no method of measurement at your command to enable you to ascertain exactly what I am referring to, yet perhaps this will make it somewhat understandable.I will use, Joseph, an example having to do with your own profession.你没有任何评量的方法，可以让你用来确认我指的是什么。约瑟，我将举一个与你的职业有关的例子，也)许这可让它变得稍微可以理解。
Take two paintings of the same shape and size; that is, two paintings that take up the same amount of space in your universe.One painting is extremely crude and poorly done.The other painting not only seems of superior quality, but also appears to undergo a continual transformation while still taking up the same amount of space.以两幅形状大小相同的画为例；也就是说，两幅画在你们的宇宙中占据了相同的空间。一幅画极其粗糙，做工也很拙劣。另一幅画不仅看起来质量上乘，而且似乎还在不断地发生着变化，而所占据的空间仍然是一样的。
Say that the painting is a landscape, and that this transformation includes within the same amount of space the addition continually of more trees, more hills; that the hills still within the same amount of space allotted to the painting grow taller, and yet never shoot past the frame.Imagine this transformation including also the addition of distance, reaching ever further backward while not disturbing the back side of the canvas.就说那是一幅风景画，这种变化包括在同样的空间内不断增加更多的树木、更多的山丘；山丘仍然在分配给这幅画的同样空间内增高，但永远不会越出画框。想像一下，这种转变还包括距离的增加，在不干扰画布背面的前提下，不断向后延伸。
Imagine if you can the figures or inhabitants in the painting having psychological reality, all within the set limits prescribed by the given space.Imagine in other words consciousness, growth, reality and expansion, having nothing to do with expansion of space in your terms, but an almost complete freedom of psychological realities, and you will come at least within the realm of understanding what I mean by an expanding universe that has nothing to do with the expanding universe of which your scientists speak.如果可以的话，想像一下画中的人物或居民有其心理的实相，并全都在这给定的空间所设定的范围之内。换句话说，想像意识、生长、实相和扩展，与你们所说的空间扩展无关，而是在心理实相上拥有几乎完全的自由，那么你至少会有点了解，我说一个扩展中的宇宙，它和你们科学家讲的扩展中的宇宙毫不相干是)什么意思。
Most realities have absolutely nothing to do with space as you imagine it.Most realities have their growth and existence in something closely akin to what we have called psychological time, and this is completely independent of space as you conceive it to be.Psychological time is a sort of climate or environment conducive to the existence of all consciousness.大部分的实相与你们想像的空间一点关系都没有。大多数实相的成长和存在都与我们所说的心理时间密切相关，而这完全独立于你们所设想的空间。心理时间是一种有利于所有意识存在的环境。
You think of space as an emptiness to be filled because on your plane you fill what you call space with camouflage patterns.And I repeat: instead true space, fifth dimensional space, is the vitality and stuff of all existence itself, vital and alive, from which all other existences are woven through means which I have outlined so far in a rather sketchy fashion.Even on your plane quality, which represents a kind of expansion, does not necessarily imply an expansion of space.The universe expands continually in a qualitative manner that has nothing to do with space as it is usually envisioned.And the expansion is more vivid and valid than I can possibly explain to you at this time.你们认为，空间是一种有待填充的空无，因为在你们的层面上，你们用伪装模式填充你们所谓的空间。我再重复一遍：相反，真正的空间，第五维空间，就是所有存在本身的生命力和那些材料，生机盎然，活力四射，所有其他的存在，都是通过我迄今为止，以相当概略勾勒的方式，从中编织而出。即使在你们层面的质性(planequality)，代表着一种扩展，也不一定意味着是空间的扩张。宇宙不断地以一种质的方式(qualitativemanner)扩展，与通常设想的空间无关。而这种扩展比我现在能向你们解释的更加生动和有效。
I suggest a brief break.We managed to get some excellent material through so far, for which I am most thankful, and the quality of the material just given transcended your time and space, the expansion of quality in this case existing independently.我建议休息一会儿。到目前为止，我们成功地取得了一些很棒的资料，对此我非常感谢，刚才所提供的资料之质量，超越了你们的时间和空间，在这种情况下，质量的扩展是独立存在的。
(Now Jane gestured dramatically, arms o(现在珍做了个戏剧性的手势，甩开双臂，眼睛很黑。)
The walls of the room do not push back to receive a great idea, for example, and again, the expansion of the universe from the inside does not imply a pushing out or an inflation.比如说，房间的墙壁不会为了接收一个伟大的想法而往后推移，同样的，宇宙从内部开始的扩展，并不意味着是向外推挤或膨胀。
(Break at 9:58.Jane was dissociated—way out, she said.Also her hands felt fat again.She wears two rings, one on each fourth finger.Both came off easily, normally.Now she could not remove her wedding ring at all; the other ring finally came off at the expense of a bruised knuckle.(9:58休息。珍解离了——神飘得很远，她说。而且她觉得手又胖了。她戴着两枚戒指，两根无名指上各一枚。通常两枚都很容易拿下来。现在，她的婚戒根本摘不下来，另一枚戒指终于拿下来了，代价是指关节瘀青。
(The feeling of swollen hands lasted for a couple of minutes then began to taper off.It is my own observation that Jane experiences this enlargement when she is delivering exceptional material, and she agreed.Strangely I had never asked Seth for an explanation, so now I made it a point to remark that I hoped he would deal with it this evening.Jane’s hands felt normal to her when she began dictating again, in a normal voice.Resume at 10:07.)(双手肿胀的感觉持续了一两分钟，然后开始消退。据我自己的观察，珍在传送非常特殊的资料时，会有这种肿大的感觉，她也同意。奇怪的是，我从来没有请赛斯解释过，所以我现在特别提出来，希望他今晚能解释一下。当珍再度开始用正常的声音传述时，她感觉手也正常了。在10:07继续。)
Before I answer the question that you voiced during break, Joseph, let me continue first along the lines of our discussion.Again, the dream worldd, which is a very vivid one and a valid one, does not take up any space at all.It is also free to a very large degree of your physical time, but it does exist in the climate or environment of psychological time.在我回答你在休息期间所提出的问题之前，约瑟，让我先继续我们之前的讨论。再说一遍，梦境世界，是一个非常生动、有效、根本不占任何空间的世界。它在很大程度上也不受限于你们的物理时间，但它确实存在于心理时间的气候或环境中。
Your certainly cannot pinpoint a dream location, even if the location corresponds to a familiar one in the camouflage universe.The dream itself is not experienced in the specific camouflage location.The body lies in its bed.Though you recognize in a dream the complete furnishings of an actual house, still the dreamer lies in his bed.The two locations, the dream location and the camouflage location, appear the same but they are not the same.你们当然不能确定梦境的位置，即使这个位置与伪装宇宙中熟悉的地点相一致。梦境本身并不是在特定的伪装地点经历的。身体躺在床上。虽然在梦中，你认得一个实际房子的完整陈设，但做梦者还是躺在自己的床上。梦境位置和伪装地点，这两个所在地看似相同，但它们并不一样。
One takes up space in your universe and the other does not.The universe expands in the manner that a dream expands, taking up no camouflage space.This does not mean that there is no growth involved in the expansion of the universe.This does not imply that there is no movement.It simply implies an existence and an expansion of a qualitative manner, beyond your present measurements or complete comprehension.一个占用你们宇宙里的空间，另一个没有。宇宙以一个梦扩展的方式扩展，不占用伪装空间。这并不是说宇宙的扩展不涉及成长(growth)。这也不是意味着没有任何移动。它只是意味着，一种质的存在和扩展，超出了你们目前的测量或完整的理解。
The most full operation of the inner senses is possible only in this climate.There is so much here that I am impatient to tell you, and so little that you can understand now.Conceptions explode into being, evolve, change into something else, and yet all this within a framework that is definite but cannot be seen or touched by you, the psychological expansion even of atoms and molecules that in themselves contain condensed comprehensions beyond your understanding.The stuff of the universe is not inanimate, nor even on your plane is it an emptiness to be filled, but constantly expanding in ways that you cannot yet fathom.内在感官只有在这种环境中才能全面运作。这里有太多东西我迫不及待地想要告诉你们，但你们现在能够了解的太少了。孕育的概念爆发成了存在的东西，经过演化，变成其他东西，然而这一切都在一个明确的架构内，但你们却看不见、摸不着，甚至原子和分子的心理扩展，本身就包含超出你们能理解的浓缩的理解力(condensedcomprehensions)。宇宙的种种东西并非无生命的，甚至在你们的层面上，它也不是有待填充的空无，而是以你们还无法揣摩的方式不断扩展。
(Jane stood again at the open window, looking out as she dictated.)(珍又站在敞开的窗前，一边传述一边看着窗外。)
Even as Ruburt looks out the window, seemingly through empty space at the street, the so-called space simply is not empty, though through the specialized camouflage senses it may appear to be empty.Your outer senses merely equip you to perceive your own camouflage, but to others your camouflage may in some cases appear as empty space, while what is empty to you is filled with activity for them.即使当鲁伯看着窗外，似乎是通过空旷的空间看向街道，这所谓的空间根本就不是空的，虽然通过专门的伪装感官，它可能看起来是空的。你们的外在感官，只是配备给你们来感知你们自己的伪装，但对其他人来说，你们的伪装在某些情况下可能看起来是空的，而对你们来说是空的地方，对他们来说却充满了活动。
Your scientists’ idea of an expanding universe is so dependent upon your own limited theories that it becomes very difficult to make the matter plain.Again I entreat you to practice with the use of psychological time, for here the inner senses are given the greatest freedom from camouflage.And experiencing the resulting inner expansion, you will perhaps come somewhat closer to the ideas involved in our real expanding universe.你们的科学家关于宇宙膨胀的想法，是如此依赖你们自己有限的理论，以至于变得很难把这件事说个明白。我再次恳请你们练习运用心理时间，因为在这里，内在感官被赋予了最大自由，不需要伪装。而且也体验到因此而来的内在扩展，你们或许就会稍微比较接近和我们真正的宇宙扩展有关的观念。
The dream analogy is also very helpful here, and I suggest that you read it carefully.梦比喻在这里也非常有帮助，我建议你们仔细阅读。
As far as Ruburt’s fat hands and your own are concerned, this is in a very limited manner a hint of the qualities of extension that can be expected.This is of an entirely different kind of experience, having nothing to do with our discussion immediately previous.This extension involves a reaching out of tissue capsule.The degree is rather limited, the opposite experience being one of contraction.This can be compared most clearly to a pulsation, or really a beat that can follow a more or less regular rhythm.至于鲁柏的胖手和你自己的手，就一个非常有限的意义来说，这是暗示可以期待的延伸性质。这是一种完全不同的体验，和我们刚才的讨论没有任何关系。这种延伸涉及组织囊的外展。程度相当有限，相反的经验是一种收缩。这可以非常清楚地比作一个脉动，或者说是一个可以遵循多少是有规律节奏的节拍。
It involves the inner self, and the tissue capsule which also surrounds the physical camouflage body in a manner and for a purpose which I have briefly explained in an earlier session.它涉及到内在自己，以及组织囊，组织囊也以一种方式和目的围绕着物质伪装身体，我在前面的课程中已经简单解释过。
I suggest that you take a break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:32.Jane was dissociated as usual.Resume at 10:38.)(10:32休息。珍解离如常。在10:38继续)
Briefly let me mention that transportation in the universe, that is transportation as such, is basically unnecessary.This is only a preliminary statement for other sessions, and I will not go into it deeply at this time.我简单提一下，宇宙中的运输[transportation]，也就是说，这样的运输，基本上是不必要的。这只是为其他课程所做的初步陈述，我这时候不打算深入讨论它。
When, or by the time that transportation difficulties are solved, you will no longer need transportation.Use of the inner senses makes transportation as you think of it completely unnecessary, since complete use of the inner senses amounts to communication to a degree so near perfect and so independent of so-called space, that transportation through space in those terms becomes an outmoded method of communication.当，或者到了运输的困难被解决了的时候，你们就不再需要运输了。内在感官的运用，会使你认为的运输完全没有必要，因为内在感官的全面运用，使得沟通到达一个几近完美的程度，而且如此独立于所谓的空间，以至于在这些方面，穿过空间的运输变成一种过时的沟通方法。
The inner senses provide their own "transportation," and put that in quotes.Transportation as such is valid only within a space framework and within a time concept, such as those on your own plane.The "transportation" (in quotes) of the inner senses consists mainly of what you might call a changing of frequencies or vibrations or pulsations, a transformation of vitality-form from one particular pattern or aspect to another.内在感官提供它们自己的"运输"，把它放在引号里。这样的运输(穿过空间的运输)只有在空间架构内及时间概念内有效，比如你们自己层面上的那些。内在感官的"运输"(加引号)主要包括你们可称之为频率、振动、或脉动的变化，是生命力形式从一个特定)的模式或面向到另一个的转变。
The movement through space is a distortion.I expect to say much more about this in further sessions, as it is extremely important; and you can see now perhaps why our eighth sense, disentanglement, is so important, since the inner self must disentangle itself from a particular camouflage before it can change.It must ignore, so to speak, one set of camouflage and be able to either adopt another smoothly or to dispense with camouflage entirely.穿过空间的移动是一种扭曲，我预计在以后的课程中对此作更多的说明，因为它极其重要；你们现在或许可以看出，为什么我们的第八种内在感官---脱离纠结，是这么重要了，因为内在自己必须在它能够改变之前，先脱离一个特定的伪装。可以这样说，它必须忽略一套伪装，并且能够顺利地采用另一套，或者完全摒弃伪装。
The grouping of inner senses with which we are now concerned deal with the disentanglement of one set of camouflage patterns and the taking up of another set.The groupings of inner senses most dependent upon the use of psychological time are those which involve a nearly complete disentanglement from camouflage pattern, without taking on other patterns, and these are perhaps the most important because they come closer to the direct experience of unveiled reality.我们现在所关注的这组内在感官，处理的是脱离一套伪装模式的纠结，并采用另一套模式。最依赖于使用心理时间的那组内在感官，就是涉及几近完全脱离伪装模式的纠缠，且不必采用其他模式的那些内在感官，而且这些也许是最重要的，因为它们更接近于对揭开的实相的直接体验。
In some ways you see, your dream worldd is actually much closer to the direct experience of reality than is your waking world, where the operation of the inner senses is shielded so from your own awareness.This is not to say that the dream worldd is more important to you in your present situation, merely that it contains more truth about the source of your own existence.在某些方面，你的梦世界，实际上比你的醒时世界更接近实相的直接经验，在醒时世界，你内在感官的运作被你自己的意识所屏蔽。这并不是说，在你目前的)情况下，梦世界对你更重要，只是说，它包含了更多关于你自己存在源头的真相。
You will find that we have covered some excellent points here this evening, that will be most helpful in further discussions.There are other facets that I will take up but at a later time.I am looking forward to summer discussions.Maybe Ruburt will even wear a bathing suit.你会发现，今晚，我们在这里已经涵盖了一些极佳的重点，这对进一步的讨论很有帮助。还有其他一些方面，我会在以后的时间进行介绍。我期待着在夏日里的讨论。鲁柏或许会穿着泳衣呢。
("Maybe.")("也许"。)

The pulsating that I mentioned earlier as extension and contraction involves the use of certain frequencies inherent in the tissue capsule, and to some small degree represents or is a limited aspect of the ability of the inner self to change frequencies and pulsations in an even freer, less limited manner.I wanted to make this point earlier.我前面提到的扩展和收缩的脉动，涉及到组织囊内某些特定频率的使用，在小小的程度上代表了，或者说)是内在自己能力的一个有限的面向，以一种甚至更自由、更不受限的方式，改变频率和脉冲。我稍早前想说的就是这一点。
Ruburt’s experience with the slip of paper represented a clairvoyance, as did his experience with the clock; and clairvoyance is concerned with camouflage pattern.Telepathy for example is not.In further experiences of this kind, Ruburt will be able to "see" (in quotes) more as his ability grows.鲁柏对那张纸的经验代表了一次千里眼的体验，就像他的钟表经验一样；千里眼涉及到伪装模式。心灵感应则否。这类经验再进一步，随着能力的增强，鲁柏将能"看到"(引号)更多。
The piece of paper was, as he saw it, written in the hand of Durosha Piry.It was on a desk.The notation mentioned your name, along with other names of artists whose works were under consideration by that woman to be placed in business offices.他看见的这张纸，是杜罗莎.皮里(DuroshaPiry)的手迹。在一张桌子上。注释中提到了你的名字，还有其他艺术家的名字，那个女人考虑把他们的作品放在办公室。
(The formal name of Dee Masters, Jane’s supervisor at the gallery is Durosha Piry Masters.)(珍在画廊的主管，迪·马斯特斯(DeeMasters)的全名是杜罗莎.皮里.马斯特斯。)

I hope that you will develop along these lines, but the rate of progress is of course up to you, and your individual abilities will vary as to particulars.This is to be expected.As a rule the use of psychological time will help you both develop in a fairly balanced manner.I have enjoyed this evening’s session.After some more material with our inner senses perhaps we shall take some time out to go into your various life readings, as I have let them go to get other material to you.我希望你们朝着这些方向发展，但进展速度当然取决于你们，你们的个人能力在细节上会有所不同。这是可以预料的。一般来说，心理时间的运用有助于你们两人以一种相当平衡的方式发展。我很享受今天晚上的课。再说一点我们的内在感官资料之后，也许我们应该分出一些时间来详谈你们各自的生命解读，我把它们放在一边，为的是给你们一些其他的资料。

SESSION 44第44节内在宇宙法则1,2,3,4
APRIL 15, 1964 9 PM WEDNESDAY AS INSTRUCTED1964年4月15日星期三晚上9点，按指示
(At 11:00 AM today, while relaxing briefly Jane experienced what she believes to be another attempt at clairvoyance.Behind her closed eyes the customary blackness began to turn gray, then white, or light; she saw finally a milky diffused light, as though she was looking at a frosted glass.She saw nothing else, she said, although she definitely had the feeling that it was possible for this opaque light to turn transparent, and thus allow her to see things.(今天上午11:00，当珍在短暂的放松时，她认为又经历了一次千里眼的尝试。在她紧闭的双眼背后，通常的黑暗变成了灰色，然后变成白色，或是变亮了，最后她看见一道扩散的乳白色的光，就像她在看一片磨砂玻璃那样。她说除此之外，她看不到其他东西，不过，她很确定她有一种感觉，这道不透明的光可能会变透明，从而让她看到东西。
(At 8:40 PM Jane lay down for a brief rest, while I sat quietly in an attempt to use psychological time.I experienced nothing untoward; Jane however got the thought of dream locations taking up no space.I called her at 8:55.She felt somewhat relaxed, she said, and not as nervous.(晚上8:40，珍躺下休息，我静静地坐着，试图运用心理时间。我没有经验到任何出乎意料的情况；不过，珍却有了梦境地点不占据空间的想法。8:55我叫醒他。她说，她感觉有些放松，没有那么紧张。
(Jane began dictating in a rather normal voice and at her regular rate, but before long her delivery slowed down once again.This slower rhythm has been so prevalent in recent sessions that it appears to be becoming the rule.It does make it easier to take notes.Her eyes darkened as usual.(珍用相当正常的声音和速度开始传述，不过没多久，她的传述再度慢了下来。这种比较缓慢的节奏在最近的课中经常发生，几乎成了惯例。这倒使我做笔记更容易一些。她眼睛漆黑如常。
Good evening, playmates.晚安，玩伴们。
("Good evening, Seth.")("晚安，赛斯"。)
I am pleased that you are so pleased with our last session.I was in fact going to speak about dream locations, in that you definitely experience these locations in your dreams, which take up no room in your space.我很高兴你对我们上一节课如此满意。事实上，我正是要谈论梦境地点，因为你们的确在梦中经历了这些地点，这些地点不占你们的空间。
On one level they could be said not to exist, and yet they do exist.While in your dream, you are able to see and touch and move about in these locations.It is only when you awake that they escape you.This should be considered along with our material on the expanding universe, since dream locations represent, certainly, a reality, even a framework that has no existence in your space; and measured purely along the lines used to measure your space, you would receive no hint at all of their existence or reality.Measured purely in terms of your camouflage conceptions, many things which you know to exist would seem not to exist.在某个层次上，它们可说是子虚乌有的，然而它们又确实存在。当你在梦中时，你能够看到、触摸到，并在这些地方走动。只有当你醒来时，它们才会逃逸。这应该和我们谈宇宙扩展的资料一起考虑，因为梦中的地点当然代表了一个实相，甚至有一个不存在于你们空间里的架构；纯粹按照用来测量你们的空间的惯用标准来测量，你们根本不会收到有关它们存在或它们实相的任何线索。纯粹按照你们的伪装概念来衡量，许多你们知道存在的事物似乎就不存在了。
You cannot deny your own psychological reality, but sometimes it seems as if you would if you could.You cannot feel outwardly, or see or measure, an emotion, and an emotion takes up no space.Emotions still exist.Feelings intensify.In value they can be said to expand, yet this very real intensity or value expansion of a feeling takes up no more additional space than it did at its conception.你无法否认你自己的心理实相，但有时似乎如果你能否认，你会否认。你无法从外面去感受、或者看见、衡量一种情绪，情绪不占空间。情绪仍然存在。感觉加剧。在值(value)上，它们可以说是扩张的，然而这种非常真实的强度或值的扩展，所占据的空间，并不比它在孕育概念时占用更多的额外空间。
The color red is more vivid than the color black, using black here as color.However red takes up no more space than black.In other words expansion, occurring in terms of value quality, or gradations of intensity, has nothing to do with expansion in space.And expansion of value and intensity is the only real form of expansion.红色这个颜色比黑色更鲜艳。然而红色并不比黑色占用更多的空间。换句话说，扩展的发生，就值的特性，或强度的等级而言，与空间的扩展无关。而值与强度的扩展是唯一真实的扩展形式。
I have said that the mind cannot be detected by your instruments at present.The mind does not take up space, and yet the mind is the value that gives power to the brain.The mind expands continually, both in individual terms and in terms of the species as a whole, and yet the mind takes up neither more nor less space, whether it be the mind of a flea or a man.我说过，目前你们的仪器无法探测到心智。心智并不占据空间，但心智却是赋予头脑力量的那个值(value)。无论是从个体还是从整个物种的角度来看，心智都在不断地扩展，无论是跳蚤或人的心智，都不会占用更多或更少的空间。
The mind simply does not exist in spatial terms.You have no way of measuring the mind's expansion, any more than you can measure the expansion of the universe as long as you are thinking in terms of expansion in space.To deny the reality of what does not exist in space would be to deny much of mankind's own heritage and abilities.心智根本不以空间的方式存在。只要你们一直从空间扩展的角度思考，就没有办法测量心智的扩展，也无法测量宇宙的扩展。否认在空间中不存在实相这个事情，就等于否认人类自身的很多传承和能力。
Again, the dream worldd exists in a very personal, vivid and valid manner, but the dream worldd does not take up so many inches or feet or yards or acres.再说一次，梦世界以一种非常个人、生动又有效的方式存在，但梦世界并不会占用这么多英寸、或英尺或码或英亩。
Now we get into something else.现在，我们进入另一个话题。
If the dream worldd exists, and it does, and if it does not exist in space, then in what, or where, does it have its existence, and what paths if any will lead us to it?如果梦世界存在，而它也确实存在，如果它不存在于空间，那么，它存在于什么，或是在哪里存在？要是有路径的话，什么路径会把我们引向它？
(Jane tapped on my desk for emphasis.She spoke quite slowly.Also throughout these first few pages, I believe I experienced quite a few instances of telepathy; I would catch a phrase for instance just before Jane uttered the same words.)(珍拍了拍我的桌子以示强调。她说得很慢。前面这几页从头到尾，我相信我经历了好几次心灵感应：比方说，在珍开口之前，我会捕捉到一模一样的字)句。)
Since I have also said that basically the universe has no more to do with space in your terms than does the dream worldd, you may deduce a similarity between the medium in which both the basic universe and the dream worldd may be found.You must understand here that your idea of space is something quite different from the reality of our fifth dimensional space.I want to make this plain again before we continue.我还说过，基本上，宇宙与你们所说的空间，并没有比梦世界与你们所说的空间，有更多的关系，那么你们可以从基本宇宙和梦世界都可能存在的媒介中，推断出一种相似性。这里你们必须明白，你们的空间观念，和我们第五维空间的实相很不一样。在我们继续下去之前，我想再把这一点说清楚。
Your idea of space is some completely erroneous conception of an emptiness to be filled.Things, planets, stars, nebulae, come into being in this universe of yours.They are born continually according to your latest theories, and this universe expands—pushed, so to speak, so that its sides bulge, the outer galaxies literally bursting out into nowhere.True fifth-dimensional space, as I have said often, is to the contrary vital energy, itself alive, possessing endless abilities of transformation, forming all existences, forming even the camouflage universe with which you are familiar, and which you attempt to probe so ineffectively.你们认为空间是一个有待填补的空无，这是个完全错误的概念。物体、星球、恒星、星云，这些东西在你们的这个宇宙中形成。根据你们最新的理论，它们不断地诞生，这个宇宙也不断地膨胀—被推着(pushed)，可以这么说，以至于，其周边凸起，外围的星系简直是迸发到了无边无际。真正的第五维空间，就像我经常说的那样，正好相反，是生命能量(vitalenergy)，它本身是活的，拥有无尽的转换能力，形成所有的存在，甚至形成你们所熟悉的，试图探究却徒劳无功的伪装宇宙。
This fifth dimensional space, this basic universe of reality of which I speak, expands constantly in terms of intensity and quality and value, in a way that has nothing to do with your idea of space.这第五维空间，这个我所说的实相的基本宇宙，在强度、特性和值上不断地扩展，这种扩展方式与你们的空间观念毫无关系。
The basic inner universe beneath all camouflage does not have an existence in space at all, as you envision it.Space as you envision it, that is as an emptiness to be filled, is a camouflage.在所有伪装之下的基本内在宇宙(basicinneruniverse)，根本不是如你们所设想的那样存在于空间。你们所设想的空间，也就是一个有待填补的空无，是一种伪装。
I suggest that you take your first break.我建议你们第一次休息。
(Break at 9:31.Jane was dissociated as usual.She said Seth came through clear as a bell.Her voice had become very quiet, her pacing slow.She resumed dictating in the same manner at 9:35.)(9:31休息。珍解离如常。她说，赛斯传来的声音，像铃声般清晰无比。她的声音变得很安静，踱步很)慢。9:35。她以同样的方式继续传述。)
Dreams, the dream worldd, these do not exist to any real degree in time as you know time.Weeks may be experienced in a dream, and the dream may take but a split second of your clock time.The inner thoughts of the mind exist but briefly in time, and even this small tinge of time that touches both dreams and ideas is not basic to either the dream or the idea.梦，梦世界，在你所知的时间里，不存在任何真实程度的时间。在梦里可能经历了几个星期，而这个梦可能只用了你钟表时间的一瞬间。心智的内在想法)(innerthoughtsofthemind)在时间上只是瞬间的存在，即使是触及梦与念头的这一丁点时间，对梦或念头也都不是基本的。
This tinge of time is an attribute of the physical camouflage form only, and even then the relationship between time and ideas, and time and dreams, is a nebulous one.As I have mentioned, though you experience two days in a dream, you are while in that dream free from the time involved, in that you do not age two days, although you have psychologically experienced that apparent time.这一丁点时间只是物质伪装形式的一个属性，就算这样，时间和念头(ideas)之间的关系，以及时间和梦之间的关系也是模糊的。我说过，虽然你在梦中经历了两天，但你在那个梦中是没有涉及到时间的，因为你虽然在心理上经历了那明显的时间，但你并没有老了两天。
The dream worldd and the mind are touched by time, and exist in it only in so far as these realities dip into the camouflage universe.Basically both the dream worldd and the ideas of the inner mind do not have their existence in time, although they may be visible from the perspective of time, viewed from the physical form.唯有在这些实相浸入(dipinto)伪装宇宙时，梦世界和心智才会被时间触及，才存在于时间之中。基本上，梦世界和内在心智的想法(theideasoftheinnermind)都不在时间中存在，虽然从时间的角度，从物质形态上来看，它们可能是可见的。
The reality of the inner universe also does not exist basically in time as you conceive it, although in some instances parts of it may be glimpsed from the camouflage time perspective; only however a very small portion.内在宇宙的实相也基本上不存在于你们所设想的时间之内，尽管在某些情况下，从伪装时间的角度，可能瞥见它的局部；然而仅仅是很小的一部分。
If the dream worldd and the mind and the inner universe do exist, and if they do not exist in space, and if they do not exist basically in time, though they may be glimpsed through time, then your question will be:in what medium or in what manner do they exist; and without time how can they be said to exist in duration?如果梦世界、心智和内在宇宙确实存在，如果它们不存在于空间，如果它们又基本上不存在于时间，尽管它们可能通过时间被瞥见，那么你的疑问会是：它们以什么媒介或方式存在；没有时间，那怎么能说它们存在于一段持续时间(induration)中呢？
You already have many clues that I have given you.The answer itself should not seem unbelievable.你们已经有了很多我给你们的线索。答案本身不应该显得难以置信。
You know for a fact that dreams exist.You know that the mind exists, you have personal intimate direct knowledge of these.你们知道梦的确存在。你们知道心智存在，你们对这些具备个人的直接认知。
I am telling you that the basic universe exists behind all camouflage universes in the same manner, and taking up no space, that the mind exists behind the brain.我是在告诉你，基本宇宙以同样的方式存在于所有伪装宇宙之后，而且不占空间，就像心智存在于头脑之后一样。
The brain is a camouflage pattern.It takes up space.It exists in time.The mind takes up no space, it does not have its basic existence in time.The reality of the inner universe does not take up space, nor does it have its basic existence in time.Your camouflage universe, on the other hand, takes up space and has an existence in time, but it is not the real and basic universe, any more than the brain is the mind.头脑是一个伪装模式。它占据空间。存在于时间之中。心智不占用空间，在时间内没有它的基本存在。内在宇宙的实相不占用空间，在时间内也没有它的基)本存在。另一方面，你们的伪装宇宙占据空间，并在时间中存在，但它不是真实和基本的宇宙，就像头脑之于心智。
Now nevertheless the dream worldd, the mind and the reality universe do exist.They exist in a climate that we will call the value climate of psychological reality.This is the medium.This takes the place of what you call space.This value climate of psychological reality is a quality which makes all existences and consciousness possible.It is one of the most powerful principles behind or within the vitality that itself composes from itself all other phenomena.然而，梦世界、心智和实相宇宙确实存在。它们存在于一种气候(climate)中，我们将称之为心理实相之值的气候(thevalueclimateofpsychologicalreality)。这就是媒介。这取代了你们所谓的空间。这种心理实相的值的气候是一种性质，它使所有的存在和意识成为可能。它是生命力背后或内部最强大的原则之一，而生命力本身就是从它自己本身构成了所有其他的现象。
I suggest that you take your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 10:01.Jane was dissociated as usual.It was a very quiet and peaceful session.Jane resumed dictating in her slow and deliberate manner at 10:06.)(10:01休息。珍解离如常。这是一节非常安静、祥和的课程。珍恢复了她缓慢而从容的传述，10:06。)
One of the main attributes of this value climate is spontaneity, that shows itself in the existence of the only sort of time that has any real meaning, that of the spacious present.这个值的气候的主要属性之一是自发性(spontaneity)，这表现在唯一一种具有任何真实意义的时间的存在上，那就是广阔的现在。
The spacious present does not contradict the existence of durability, but durability does not imply the existence of a future as you conceive it.Now this may appear contradictory, but later I hope that you will understand this more clearly.The spacious present, while existing spontaneously, while happening simultaneously, still contains within it qualities of duration.广阔的现在与持久性(durability)的存在并不矛盾，而持久性并不意味著有你们所设想的一个未来的存)在。现在，这可能显得很矛盾，但以后我希望你们能更清楚地理解这一点。广阔的现在，虽然是自发性的存在、同时性地发生着，但它仍然包含着持久)(duration)的品质。
An idea is not itself aware of past, present and future for example, and yet having no experience with present, past and future, it still endures.Nor does the duration involved in the spacious present in any way involve a suspension in terms of, for example, growth forbidden to achieve maturity.比方说，念头本身并不知道到过去、现在和未来，然而在没有经历现在、过去和未来的情况下，它仍然会持续下去。广阔的现在所涉及的持续时间，也丝毫不涉及，例如，禁止成长以达到成熟的暂停。
Growth in your camouflage universe often involves the taking up of more space.Actually in our inner universe of reality growth exists in terms of the value or quality expansion of which I have spoken, and does not, I repeat, does not imply any sort of space expansion.Nor does it imply, as growth does in your camouflage universe, a sort of projection into time.在你们的伪装宇宙内，成长往往意味着占据更多的空间。事实上，在我们实相的内在宇宙中，成长存在于我说过的值(value)或品质(quality)的扩展之内，而且没有，我再重复一遍，没有意味着任何一种空间扩展的意思。它也没有意味着，像你们伪装宇宙的成长那样，一种进入到时间的投射。
I realize that this material is difficult, and I am giving it to you in as simple terms as possible.If growth is one of the most necessary laws of your camouflage universe, value fulfillment corresponds to it in the inner reality universe.我知道这个资料很难，我是用尽可能简单的术语讲给你们听。如果成长是你们伪装宇宙中最不可或缺的法则之一，那么，在内在实相宇宙中，对应于它的就是值的充盈*(valuefulfillment)(*译注:一种充值的概念，内在宇宙或整体自己，行动，创造，经验，丰盈)自身，然后再行动创新，一直在成为becoming之中，没有完成之时，这对应于伪装宇宙中的成长。)。
(Now Jane came up to the table I use as a desk during sessions.With one foot on a chair, she leaned over to supervise each word I wrote.The next paragraph represents probably the longest period of time she refrained from pacing back and forth while dictating.)(现在，珍走向我在上课期间用做书桌的桌子前。她一只脚踩在椅子上，俯身监督我写的每一个字。下一个段落，可能是她传述中，停止来回踱步时间最长的一次。)
Now the so-called laws of your camouflage universe do not apply to the inner universe.They do not even apply to other camouflage planes.However, the laws of the inner universe apply to all camouflage universes, and all consciousnesses on any plane must follow the basic laws of the inner universe.Some of these basic laws have counterparts known and accepted on various camouflage planes.There are various manifestations of these laws and various names given to them.现在，你们伪装宇宙的所谓法则，并不适用于内在宇宙。它们甚至不适用于其他的伪装层面。然而，内在宇宙的法则却适用于所有的伪装宇宙，任何层面上的所有意识，都必须遵循内在宇宙的基本法则。这些基本法则中的一些法则，在不同的伪装层面上都有相对应的法则，被人们所知和接受。这些法则有各种表现形式，也有各种名称。
(Now Jane resumed pacing again.)(现在，珍再次恢复来回踱步。)
These basic laws are followed on many levels in your own universe.We will go into these laws in time.So far I have given you but one, which is value fulfillment.在你们自己的宇宙中，这些基本法则在很多层次上都被遵循着。我们将适时讨论这些法则。到目前为止，我只给了你们一个，那就是，值的充盈(valuefulfillment)。
In your physical universe this rule is followed as physical growth.The entity follows this rule through the cycle of reincarnations.The species of mankind, and all other species in your universe on your particular horizontal plane, follow this law under the auspices of evolution.On other planes this law is carried through in other manners, but it is never ignored.在你们的物质宇宙中，物质的增长遵循这个法则。存有通过循环转世遵循这个法则。人类这个物种，以及你们宇宙中所有其他物种，在你们这特定的水平层面上，都在演化的支持之下，遵循这个法则。在其他的层面上，这个法则是以其他方式贯彻的，它永远不会被忽略。
I suggest because of the importance of the material that you take a break.因为资料的重要性，我建议你们休息一下。
(Jane was dissociated; indeed way out, as she put it.She looked over the above material during break because she wanted to know what she had been talking about.Resume at 10:35.)(珍解离了，用她的话说，她出神出得很远。休息时，她看了看上面的资料，因为她想知道自己说的是什么内容。10:35继续。)
The second law of the inner universe is energy transformation.This occurs constantly.内在宇宙的第二条法则是能量转换(energytransformation)。这在不断地发生着。
Energy transformation and value fulfillment, all existing within the spacious present, add up to a durability that is at the same time spontaneous.Energy transformation and value fulfillment add up to a durability that is simultaneous.能量转换与值的充盈，都存在于广阔的现在，加起来就是一种同时自发的持久性。能量转换与值的充盈加起来就是一种同时的持久性。
(Here, Jane smiled.)(这里，珍笑了。)
You may see what we are getting into here.Our third law is spontaneity, and despite all appearances of beginning and end, despite all appearances of death and decay, all consciousness exists in the spacious present, in a spontaneous manner, in simultaneous harmony, and yet within the spacious present there is also durability.这里，你可能看出我们正要讨论什么了。我们内在宇宙的第三条法则是自发性(spontaneity)，尽管有开始和结束的所有表象，尽管有死亡与衰败的所有表象，所有的意识都以自发的方式存在于广阔的现在，存在于同时的和谐中，然而，在广阔的现在，也有持久性。
Durability is our fourth law.Durability within the framework of the spacious present would not exist were it not for the laws of value fulfillment and energy transformation.These make duration within the spacious present not only possible but necessary.持久性(Durability)是我们内在宇宙的第四条法则。如果没有值的充盈和能量转换的法则，在广阔的现在架构内的持久性就不会存在。这两者使得在广阔的现在之内的持久性不仅可能，而且必要。
Now, on your particular camouflage universe you are learning energy transformation.And in your case you are learning to transform inner energy by forming it into physical constructions that the plane enables you to manipulate by the formation of particular outer senses for this purpose.You are severely limited as yet in the use of your abilities.When the two laws of value fulfillment and energy transformation are mastered, then duration is a natural consequence.现在，在你们特定的伪装宇宙中，你们正在学习能量转换。就你们来说，你们正在学习通过将内在能量形成物质结构来转换它，这个层面使你能够通过形成特定的外在感官来操作这个目的。但到目前为止，你们在能力的使用上，还受到严重的限制。当掌握了值的充盈与能量转换这两条法则，那么，持续(duration)，就是一个自然的结果。
What you consider death has no more basic reality than has your idea of time and space.Death really represents a blind spot in your present ability to perceive energy transformation, and even value fulfillment.Death merely represents the termination of your own perception, that is, the termination of your understanding.Your ability here amounts to a complete dwindling of comprehension.Your senses are not equipped to perceive the transformation of energy from one form to another.你们所认为的死亡，并不比你们对时间和空间的想法，更具有基本的实相。死亡，其实代表你现在感知能量转换的能力，甚至值的充盈能力的一个盲点。死)亡，仅仅是代表你自己感知的终止，也就是说，你理解的终止。你们这方面的能力，相当于理解力的完全萎缩。你们的感官，并不具备感知能量从一种性式到另一种形式的能力。
Certainly the birth of a child is really basically just as incomprehensible, but this transformation is projected into, rather than out of, your sphere of understanding.What you call death is merely the transformation of your own energy onto a sphere that cannot be perceived by the outer senses.I hope that I have made this material plain enough for your plane.当然，一个孩子的出生确实从根本上是不可思议的，但这个转换，是一种投射进入(而不是离开)你们的理解领域。你们所谓的死亡，只不过是你们自己的能量转换到一个无法被外在感官感知的领域。我希望对你们的层面，我已经把这个资料讲得够清楚了。
(Jane leaned smiling over the desk.)(珍微笑着靠在桌前。)
Actually, duration itself is dependent upon such transformation.We have managed together to do extremely well with this evenings session, and I dare say that I came through in excellent fashion.实际上，持续本身，就取决于这样的转换。我们已经成功地共同完成了今晚的课，我敢说，我过来的方式极为出色。
I want to make one note here, that again experience in the use of psychological time will bring you close to an understanding of the value climate of psychological reality, for obvious reasons.Psychological time indeed is a part of this climate as it appears in fairly uncamouflaged form in your own universe.You can get the feel of it.我想在这里说明一点，使用心理时间的经验，将会带领你们接近对心理实相值的气候(valueclimate)的理解，原因很明显。心理时间的确是这个心理实相值的气候的一部分，它以相当不加伪装的形式，出现在你)们自己的宇宙中。你们可以感觉得到它。
I suggest your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 11:00.Again Jane was fully dissociated.Her delivery was still very slow when she resumed at 11:05.)(11:00休息。珍再次完全地解离。11:05恢复时，她的传讯还是很慢。)
I am not giving you these laws necessarily in the order of their importance, merely in the order which is easiest for me to deliver to you.Creation is obviously one of the basic laws, which we will call the fifth law.我给你们这些法则，不一定是按照它们的重要性，只是按照我最容易向你们介绍的顺序。创造性)(Creation)显然是基本法则之一，我们称之为内在宇宙的第五法则。
In your physical universe this law is followed through idea constructions which become idea approximations of inner reality that are, nevertheless, distorted to a large degree, and make up the various camouflage patterns with which you are familiar.在你们的物质宇宙里，这条法则是通过理念建构而被遵循的，这些理念构建成为了内在实相的近似物，然而，它们在很大程度上是被扭曲的，构成形形色色你们所熟悉的伪装模式。
We will go into these laws, and outline others in future sessions.You will see also how the inner senses are equipped to perceive basic inner realities of the inner universe, in much the same manner that your outer senses are equipped to manipulate within your camouflage universe.我们将在今后的课程中，详细探讨这些法则，并且概略介绍一下其他的法则。你们也会看到，内在感官如何配备来感知内在宇宙的基本内在实相，和你们的外在感官配备来感知你们的伪装宇宙操纵的方式差不多。
This material is actually not nearly as difficult to understand as it may seem.Intuitively you should pick up much of it.The intuitions are not bound by the so-called laws of logic, and cause and effect.They do not take time as you know it into consideration, therefore they are not bound by continuity or limited to communication of words or even thoughts, strung out one after another.这个资料，其实并不像它看起来的那么难理解。在直觉上，你们应该能理解大部分。直觉不受所谓的逻辑定律，以及因-果关系的束缚。它们并没有把你们知道的时间列入考虑，因此它们不受连续性的束缚，也不局限于一个接一个串起来的文字，甚至是思想的交流。
The intuitions are able to accept conceptual reality to some degree.They can feel the content and validity of a concept, where the brain itself may fall short.I am tempted to go into more laws this evening.However it is best that I withhold them until you grow more familiar with this evening’s material.直觉能够接受概念的实相(conceptualreality)到某种程度。它们能够感觉到一个概念的内容和效力，而这是头脑本身所短缺的。我今晚很想探讨更多的法则。然而，我最好还是把它保留到，等你们更熟悉了今晚的资料以后再说。
Remember however our universe that fulfills itself yet takes up no space, and our imaginary painting in which distance appears ever further in the background, while never touching the back of the painting, and this may give you some intuitive understanding of our spacious present that has duration, and yet takes up no space.不过，请记住，我们的宇宙，体现它自己，却不占用空间，还有我们那幅想像的画，在画中，距离在背景中似乎越来越远，却永远不会触及画的背面，这也许可以让你们对我们那广阔的现在有一些直观的理解，它有持久性却不占空间。
Contradictions, or rather apparent contradictions in terms will arise only out of a false conception on your part, mostly as a result of the erroneous cause- and effect system.Obviously cause and effect has only limited application even on your own plane and in your own camouflage universe.矛盾，或相当明显的矛盾，只会出于你们的错误概念，多半是错误的因果体系造成的。显然，即使在你们自己的层面上和在你们自己的伪装宇宙中，因果的)应用也很有限。
If cause and effect were an absolute law, then continuity would also have to be an absolute law, and all or any evidences of clairvoyance, or viewing the future, would be absolutely impossible, even in your universe, and this simply is not so.It is only because there is basically no cause and effect, but merely apparent cause and effect, and no past, present and future, that clairvoyance is possible in your universe.如果因果关系是一个绝对法则，那么连续性也必须是一个绝对的法则，所有或任何千里眼，或预见未来的证据，即使在你们的宇宙里，也都绝对不可能，但根本不是这样。只是因为基本上没有因果，只是表象上的因果，也没有过去、现在和未来，所以，千里眼在你们的宇宙中才有可能。
And while awareness of clairvoyance is fairly rare, it does exist; and though watered down in most instance, is a natural method of warning individuals of happenings with which their own outer senses would not be familiar.It is a natural method of protecting the individual by giving him an inner knowledge of events.Without constant clairvoyance on the part of every man and woman, existence on your plane would involve such inner, psychological insecurity that it would be completely unbearable.虽然，千里眼的觉察相当罕见，但它确实存在；虽然在大多数情况下被淡化了，但它是一种自然的方法，可以警告个人，他们自己的外在感官不熟悉的事情。它是一种自然的方法，通过给予个人对事件的内在知识来保护他。要不是每个男人和女人一直都有千里眼，在你们层面上的存在，将会涉及这种内在的、心理上的不安全感，那将是完全无法承受的。
Individuals are always warned of disasters, so that the organism can prepare itself ahead of time.The day of death is known.Consciously such knowledge is not given to the ego for obvious reasons, but every organism, through its inner senses, is equipped with subconscious knowledge of personal disasters, deaths, and so forth, the personality itself deciding beforehand what it considers disastrous; and the members of the species as a whole know in advance of their wars.As telepathy operates constantly at a subconscious level, as a basis for all language and communication, so clairvoyance operates continually so that the physical organism can prepare itself to face its challenges.个体总是被警告有灾难，这样机体就可以提前做好准备。死亡的日子是知道的。由于明显的原因，这样的知识在意识上是不会给自我的，但每个有机体，通过它的内在感官，都配备了关于个人灾难、死亡等的潜)意识知识，人格本身事先决定了它认为是灾难性的；整个物种的成员，都事先知道他们的战争。正如心灵感应在潜意识层次不断运作，作为所有语言和沟通的基础，同样的，千里眼也在持续不断地运作，以使身体有机体可以做好准备去面对挑战。
The inner senses also convey the knowledge that death is merely an energy transformation, and your almost numberless religions merely represent idea symbols that attempt to make this knowledge plain to the ego.That they deal with distortions and camouflage material is not to be wondered at. They have managed in some way to make this inner knowledge a part of the ego-understanding of the species.内在的感官也传达了这样的知识，即死亡只是一种能量转换，而你们几乎数不胜数的宗教，只是代表了试图让自我了解这种知识的观念象征。它们处理的是扭曲和伪装的资料，这是不必怀疑的，它们以某种方式，设法让这份内在知识成为小我对物种的理解的一部分。
This is quite enough for one session, my pigeons.对于一节课来说，这样就够多了，我的鸽子们。
("Can I ask a question?")("我能问个问题吗？")
You may.可以。
("Can you tell us anything about Miss Callahan tonight?"("今晚你能告诉我们一些关于卡拉汉小姐的事吗？"
(It will be remembered that in the 33rd session, page 262 [in Volume One], Seth suggested the date, April 15, 1964, as a significant one for Miss Callahan.By coincidence, this session fell on April 15, so naturally I was curious to learn more.Jane’s thought at the time of the 33rd session was that April 15th meant possibly a change for Miss Callahan, instead of her death necessarily.(应该记得，在第33节课，赛斯暗示1964年4月15日，对于卡拉汉小姐有重大意义。巧的是，今天这节课就是4月15日，所以我自然很好奇，想了解更多信)息。珍在第33节课时想到的是，4月15日可能意味着卡拉汉小姐的一个变化，而不一定是她的死亡。
(I now also was curious to see if distortion cropped up, since Seth had dealt with this problem in the 36th session to some extent.Distortion where personal material is concerned is, Jane and I feel, a possibility still, until her abilities mature.)(我现在也好奇，看看会不会出现扭曲，因为赛斯在第36节课，在一定程度上涉及过这个问题。珍和我都觉得，在她的能力成熟之前，个人资料的失真还是有可能的。)
Only that today, or rather this late evening, between this evening actually and two AM your time, she will undergo a severe crisis, and that rapid deterioration of brain tissue will set in.She is over, or will be over, the worst hump by then, and even the ego will be forced to acquiesce.今天，或者说是今天傍晚，在今天傍晚实际到你们时间凌晨两点之间，她将经历一场严重的危机，脑组织将开始快速恶化。那时候，她会度过，或将度过最严重的坎，甚至自我也会被迫默许。
The last struggles of the ego will take place in these hours.It will finally understand that it is not to be dumped aside but taken along as itself, independent as always, to stand beside other independent egos that all represent facets of the entity.在这几个小时，自我将会作最后的挣扎。自我最终将会明白，它不是要被甩在一旁，而是作为它自己，一如既往地独立，与其他独立的自我站在一起，这些自我都代表着存有的各个面向。
No powers are taken away from the ego.It has what abilities it has achieved, plus the ability to draw upon other energy which it could not draw upon.That is all I will say now along those lines.没有任何力量从自我中被剥夺。自我有它所成就的能力，外加汲取它过去无法汲取的其他能量的那份能力。在这方面，目前我要说的就这些。
The session has been an excellent one.Even old Doubting Thomas Ruburt is impressed enough with the material to admit that his precious subconscious simply could not be the source of it all.这节课非常棒。就连老疑神疑鬼的托马斯-鲁伯也对这些资料印象深刻，承认自己宝贵的潜意识根本不可能是这一切的来源。
I bid you a most fond good evening, and as usual look forward to our next meeting.I would not be surprised if your friend Philip attended.Ta ta, tootsies.我祝你们有个非常美好的夜晚，也会一如既往地期待我们的下一节课。如果你们的朋友菲利普来上课的话，我不会感到意外。拜拜。
("Good night, Seth.See you Monday. "("晚安，赛斯。周一见"。
(End at 11:39 Jane was again fully dissociated.When Seth gave us the material on Miss Callahan, I felt a chill.(11:39结束。珍再次完全解离。当赛斯给出卡拉汉小姐的资料时，我感到一阵寒意。
(Jane said that although she knows it is a job for me to do all the recording and typing for these sessions, I cannot have any idea of what it is like to be in her place.She is sometimes appalled.(珍说，虽然她知道，对这些课程的记录、打字对我来说是一份必要的工作，但是在她的位置上是一个什么样子，我没有一点概念。她有时感到震惊。
(She went on to say that as good as she wants the sessions to be, she has learned that she must overcome any feeling of responsibility for them; to do otherwise invariably makes her tense and hampers the flow of material.Again, Seth had something to say about distortions in the 36th session, in Volume One.(她接着说，尽管她希望课程很好，但她已经认识到，她必须克服对课程的任何责任感；否则只会让她)紧张，而妨碍资料的传送。再说一次，赛斯在第一册第36节课上，曾经对扭曲有过说法。
(By disclaiming any responsibility, Jane feels that she lets the material come through clearly.It has to be this way.She tried, she said, to let the material on Miss Callahan come through without distortion.At the end of the session she felt better than she had all day.)(珍觉得，通过拒绝承担任何责任，她可以让资料更加清晰地传过来。必须要这样。她说，她试着让卡拉汉小姐的资料不扭曲地透过来。课程结束时，她感觉比她一整天都要好。)
SESSION 45第45节心理实相之值的气候氛围
APRIL 20, 1964 9 PM MONDAY AS INSTRUCTED1964年4月20日星期一晚上9点按指示
(Both Jane and I have lately begun to practice psychological time regularly, if only for a few minutes each day.For myself I have nothing yet to report; and as previously noted, Jane has had some success at various times with what are usually quite brief flashes of insight.(珍和我近来已经开始有规律地进行心理时间练习，每天只要几分钟。对于我自己，还没有什么要说的；然而如前所述，珍有几次不同的成功经验，通常是相当短暂的洞见，一闪而过。
(We were by now more used to our new schedule, and felt more alert for the sessions.By 8:50 this evening Jane was nervous, as usual having no idea of Seth’s subject matter for the session.(我们现在比较习惯新的作息时间，对课程也更加留心。到今天晚上8:50，珍像往常一样，紧张不安，对赛斯今晚这节课的主题，没有任何概念。
(It was a very quiet beginning.Willy slept peacefully on the couch.Jane began dictating at a rather fast rate, in a voice a little stronger and deeper than normal.Her eyes darkened as usual she paced quite rapidly.)(这是一个非常安静的开始。威利安详地躺在沙发上睡觉。珍以相当快的速度开始传述，在语气上更有力更低沉一点。她的眼睛像往常一样漆黑，踱步节奏相当快。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth. "("晚安，赛斯"。
(Jane smiled broadly and gestured.)(珍笑容满面，还做了个手势。)
We are quite old friends, even in this existence by now, after so many sessions.Who else do you speak with more than you speak to me?即使是仅在这一生，在上了这么多课之后，我们也算是老朋友了。你和谁说话比和我说话还多？
("No one, I guess.")("没有了，我猜"。)
I am actually quite honored by my reception.You did not always greet me so kindly.You and I fell to fistfights upon a few occasions.Nor would such weighty material have appealed to you then.For that matter, neither would it have appealed to me.我真的很荣幸受到这样的招待。你并不总是这么亲切地和我打招呼。你和我有过几次拳脚相向。那时你也不会对这样沉重的资料有兴趣。就这一点而言，它也不会对我有吸引力。
Ruburt in many ways was more often than either of us, more receptive to what could not be seen or touched.But contrariwise he doubted, always probed and then often doubted quite legitimate results, as indeed he sometimes continues to do so.鲁柏在许多方面，比我们任何一个人都更容易接受看不见或摸不着的东西。但与此相反的是，他怀疑、总是探究，然后经常对非常合理的结果质疑，事实上，他有时继续这样做。
You are both, with my invaluable help, coming along very well.Your attitudes toward the outside world have certainly improved.Ten minutes of your clock time a day would certainly be of great value in the use of psychological time, and I suggest that you try this.在我无可估量的帮助下，你们俩都进展的非常好。你们对于外在世界的态度的确有所改善。每天抽出十分钟的钟表时间来利用心理时间，肯定会很有价值，我建议你们试一试。
(Now Jane began to slow up in her dictation, as she has in recent sessions.Once again her manner became quite slow and deliberate.)(像最近的课一样，现在珍的传述有点慢。再一次，她的方式变得相当缓慢且慎重。)
The value climate of psychological reality can be likened to an ocean in which all consciousness has its being.There are multitudinous levels that can be plunged into with various life forms, diverse and alien, but nevertheless interconnected and dependent one upon the other.I like the ocean analogy because you get the idea of continuous flow and motion without apparent division.心理实相之值的气候氛围可以比喻为海洋，在这个海洋里，所有的意识都有它的存在。有无数的层次可以跳入，生命形式各有不同，多元又相异，但彼此相互连结、相互依存。我喜欢这个海洋的比喻，因为你可以得到没有明显分割的连续流动和运动的概念。
As temperatures in various depths of ocean change, and as even the color of the water and of the flora and fauna change, so too in our value climate there are quality changes, and senses equipped to project and perceive the changes.There are distortions because of the limitations of the outer senses, but the inner senses do not distort.The inner senses inhabit directly the atmosphere of our value climate; and they see through the ever varying camouflage patterns, and the flux and flow of apparent change.In our sessions to some small degree you plunge into this ocean of value climate, and to the extent that you are able to divest yourselves of the clothes of camouflage, to that extent can you truly be aware of this climate.就像海洋的温度随着深度的不同而改变，甚至就像水的颜色和动植物群的颜色变化一样，在我们值的气候氛围里，也有质的变化，也有配备的感官，来投射和感知这些变化。由于外在感官的限制性，会有扭曲，但内在感官不会扭曲。内在感官直接住在我们值的气候氛围中；它们看穿不断变化的伪装模式，看穿表面变化的流变。在我们的课里，你有小小的程度，也跳入这个值的气候氛围的海洋中，而且某种程度，能够剥去自己的伪装外衣，到那个程度，你们就能真正意识到这个心理实相的气候。
What is required is more than a divesting of clothes however.To plunge into this ocean you also leave the physical body at the shore.It will be there when you get back.Your camouflage patterns can be likened to the patterns cast by sun and shadow upon the evermoving waves.As long as you keep the pattern in mind, you create it, and it is there.If you turn your head away for a moment and then look quickly back you can see only the wave.Your camouflage and your world is created by conscious focusing and unconscious concentration.Only by turning your head away for a moment can you see what is beneath the seemingly solid pattern.By plunging into our ocean of value climate you can dive beneath your camouflage system and look up to see it, relatively foundationless, floating above you, moved, formed and directed by the shifting illusions caused by the wind of will, and the force of subconscious concentration and demand.然而单单剥去伪装外衣是不够的。要跳入这个海洋，你还要把肉身留在岸边。当你回来的时候，它还会在那里。你的伪装模式可以比作阳光和阴影投射在起伏不已的波浪上的图案。只要你记住这个图案，你就能创造它，而它就在那里。如果你把头转开一下，然后快速回头一瞥，你就只能看到波浪。你们的伪装和你们的世界是被有意识的聚焦和无意识的专注创造出来的。只有把头转开片刻，你们才能看到看似坚固的模式下面是什么。借由跳入我们值的气候海洋中，你们才能潜入你们的伪装系统之下，擡头看它，相对来说它没有基础，漂浮在你们的上方，被意志之风、潜意识专注和需求的力量所造成的变化幻象所移动、形成和引导。
Yet even these camouflage patterns must follow the basic rules of the inner universe, and reflect them even if in a distortive manner.So does value expansion become reincarnation and evolution and growth.So are all the other basic laws of the inner universe followed on every plane, and reflected from the most minute to the most gigantic spectrum.但甚至是这些伪装模式，也必须遵循内在宇宙的基本法则，并反映它们，即使是以一种扭曲的方式。所以值的扩展就变成转世、演化与成长；内在宇宙的其他所有基本法则也是如此，在每一个层面上都要遵循，并从最微小到最巨大的光谱中反映出来。
Concentrating upon your own camouflage universe, you are able to distinguish only the distortive pattern, and from this pattern you deduce your ideas of cause and effect, past, present and future, and ideas of an expanding universe that bloats.Consciousness takes up no space nor is it enclosed by time, as you know time.The camouflage patterns that seem to enclose consciousness are temporary, for short term only, and for limited but necessary purpose.专注于自己的伪装宇宙，你们只能够分辨出扭曲的模式，从这个模式中你们推导出你的因果、过去、现在和未来的想法，以及膨胀的宇宙的想法。意识不占空间，也不被你们知道的时间围住。那些看似围住意识的伪装模式是暂时的，为时短暂，目的有限但必要。
Any investigation of the basic inner universe, which is the only real universe, must be done as much as possible from a point outside your own distortions, but the only way open for you to escape the distortions of your own physical universe is to journey inward.To get outside your own universe, you must travel inward, and this represents the only perspective free of distortive elements, from which valid experimentation can be carried on.Your so-called scientific, so-called objective experiments can continue for an eternity, but they only probe further and further with camouflage instruments into a camouflage universe.任何对基本的内在宇宙，也就是唯一真实的宇宙的调查，都必须尽可能地从你们自己的扭曲之外的一个点来着手，但摆脱你们自己的物质宇宙的扭曲的唯一途径是向内旅行。要到达你们自己的宇宙外面，你们必须向内旅行，这代表着唯一没有扭曲因素的角度，从这个角度可以进行有效的实验。你们所谓的科学，所谓的客观实验可以持续到永远，但它们只是用伪装的仪器在一个伪装的宇宙中越探越远。
The subconscious, it is true, has elements of its own distortions, but these are easier to escape than the tons of distortive camouflage atmosphere that weigh your scientific experiments down.潜意识，确实有其自身扭曲的因素，但这些比起成吨的扭曲伪装氛围，更容易逃脱，因为这些伪装氛围会拖累你们的科学实验。
I suggest you take your break.我建议你们休息一下。
(Break at 9:32.Jane was dissociated as usual.By the time break arrived she was speaking in a rather normal voice.Resume at 9:35.)(9:32休息。珍解离如常。到休息时间为止，她一直以正常的语调说话。9:35继续。)
You cannot have so-called objective experiments when you are surrounded by, and dealing with, and intertwined with, the elements of the camouflage universe.You are, or scientists are, working within what may be described as one small cube within literally millions of somewhat similar though different cubes, the cubes all representing various camouflage universes.当你们被伪装宇宙的成分所包围，与之打交道、并与它们纠缠不清时，你们不可能进行所谓的客观实验。你们，或者说科学家们，是在可以被描述为千千万万个有些相似，但不同的方块中的一个小方块中工作，这些方块都代表着各种伪装宇宙。
If they were ever lucky enough to pierce through their own cube, which is doubtful, they would merely discover the cube nearest to them, without ever imagining that there were literally numberless such cubes.A small portion of the spacious present appears in your cube but you see it in camouflage terms of continuity, in camouflage waves of past, present and future.如果他们够幸运，能穿透自己的方块，我怀疑他们做得到，他们只会发现离自己最近的方块，而绝不会想到有无数这样的方块。广阔的现在的一小部分，出现在你们的方块中，但你们看到的它却是伪装的持续，是过去、现在和未来的伪装波浪。
Like rats in mazes, with luck you could theoretically travel from one cube or maze to another, though practically this is impossible.But even if your experiments gave you knowledge of many of these camouflage cube universes, you would learn little of the basic uncamouflaged inner universe, where all such divisions disappear.就像迷宫里的老鼠，运气好的话，在理论上，你们可以从一个迷宫或方块旅行到另一个，虽然实际上这是不可能的。但是，即便你们的实验，给你们很多这些伪装方块宇宙的知识，你们也不会学到什么基本的无伪装的内在宇宙，在那里，所有这样的划分都消失了。
Any scientific personage of your generation will immediately panic at such suggestions as I am making.You are so taken up with your precious camouflage patterns, and so unfamiliar with the inner propulsion behind all such materializations, that it will be a while before any headway is made.你们这一代的任何科学界人士，要是听到我正在给的建议，会立即恐慌起来。你们花了那么多时间精力在你们宝贵的伪装模式上，对所有这种物质化背后的内在动力却是如此陌生，所以要想取得任何进展，还需要一段时间。
Einstein traveled within, and trusted, his own intuitions, and used his inner senses.He would have discovered much more had he been able to trust his intuitions even more, and able to leave more of the so-called scientific proof of his theories to lesser men, to give himself more inner freedom.爱因斯坦游走于内心，相信自己的直觉，他也运用他的内在感官。如果当初他能够更加信任自己的直觉，把证明他理论的更多所谓的科学证据，留给更少的人，给自己更多的内心自由，那他的发现会更多。
There is only a relatively small layer of personal material, and therefore egotistical and distortive material, at the upper reaches of the subconscious.This layer can be quickly recognized, as a rule.Ruburt recognizes it now, and he is no scientist or psychologist.For the record, you understand that I am referring to egotistical material as that portion that is concerned with the outer camouflage- oriented personality, and that the stronger inner ego actually represents the power and ability behind the outer ego.在潜意识的上层区域，只有相对来说一小层的个人资料，因此是自我本位和扭曲的资料。一般来说，这一层很快就能被认出来。鲁柏现在就可以把它认出来，而他既不是科学家，也不是心理学家。声明一下，你了解我说的自我本位资料，指的是和外在伪装导向的)人格有关的部分，而更强大的内在自我，实际上代表外在自我背后的力量与能力。
Now.Directly, so to speak, beneath this personal material in the subconscious, is racial material which could be of great value to psychologists in their study of racial histories, and resulting psychological differences of the various races.Underneath this is material dealing with the species as a whole, with its background, evolution and inner knowledge.现在。可以说，在潜意识中的这些个人资料之下，是种族资料，这资料对心理学家研究种族历史，及由此产生的不同种族的心理差异可能很有价值。在这下面，是涉及整个物种的资料，有其背景、演化和内在知识。
Beneath this, pure and simple, undistorted, there for the searching, absolutely free for the asking, is the knowledge inherent in the inner self pertaining to the inner universe as a whole, its laws and principles, its composition.Here you will find, undistorted, uncamouflaged, the innate knowledge of the creation of the camouflage universe, the mechanics involved, much of the material that I have given you, the method and ways by which the inner self as a basic inhabitant of the inner universe, existing in the climate of psychological reality, helps create the various planes of existence, constructs outer senses to project and perceive the various apparent realities or camouflages, how the inner self reincarnates on the various planes.Here you will find your answers as to how the inner self transforms energy for his own purposes, changes his form, adopts other apparent realities, and all this free for the investigation.在这之下，纯粹又简单，没有扭曲、任人搜寻、有求必应的，是内在自己天生具有的知识，关于整个内在宇宙，包含它的法则和原则、它的组成。在这里，我们将会发现与生具来的知识，没有扭曲也没有伪装，关于伪装宇宙的创造，其中涉及的机制，这方面资料我已经给了你们很多，还有内在自己作为内在宇宙的一个基本居民采行的方法和途径，存在心理实相的气候之中，这份资料帮忙创造各个不同的存在层面，建构外在感官来投射和感知形形色色外显的实相或伪装，还有内在自己如何在各个层面上转世轮回。在这里，你们将会找到你们的答案，明白内在自己如何为了自己的目的转换能量、改变形式、采纳其他外显的)实相，而且这一切任人自由探究。
Hypnotism will become more and more a tool of scientific investigation.Telepathy will be proven without a doubt, and utilized, sadly enough in the beginning, for purposes of war and intrigue.Nevertheless telepathy will enable your race to make its first contact with alien intelligence.It will not at first be recognized as such.催眠将越来越成为科学调查的一个工具。心灵感应将会被证实确有其事，并且被加以利用，但非常可悲的是，它一开始是为了达到战争和阴谋的目的。即便如此，心灵感应将使你们的种族，有能力与外星智慧)(alienintelligence)进行第一次接触。一开始你们不会认出是外星人。
(Here, Jane laughed as she paced back and forth.)(这时，珍笑了，她来回踱步。)
There is nothing any more strange in such contact than there is in my contact with you.But because you are so involved with camouflage apparent reality, contact with such intelligence will be a startling discovery.The contact made will be from one male to another, although the alien male, from another camouflage galaxy, will be more involved than you consider possible.这种接触并不会比我和你们的接触更奇怪。但是由于你们是如此参与伪装的表面现实，所以与那种智能的接触，才会显得是一个惊人的发现。所做的接触将是从一个男性到另一个男性的接触，但是，这个来自另一个伪装星系的外星男性，涉入的程度，将会比你们可能认为的还要深。
The actual telepathy contact with this alien intelligence will occur, your time I believe, not too far distant, perhaps by the year 2001.However, for reasons that I will not go into, a hitch will develop of which your scientists will not be aware, at least in your terms.The intelligence that you contact will no longer inhabit that same universe by the time that the contact is made.与这个外星智慧的实际心灵感应接触将会发生，我相信在你们的时代，不会太远，可能是2001年。然而，由于我不想细说的原因，会出现一个你们的科学家不会意识到的小插曲，至少在你们看来是这样。你们所)接触的智能体，到了双方接触的时候，将不再居住在同一个宇宙。
By then you will have discovered that your present theory of the expanding universe is in error; and this error will, nevertheless, affect your calculations as to the exact location in your space, of the intelligence that is contacted.The contact will be made, I believe, in Australia.到那时，你们将会发现，你们现有的宇宙膨胀理论是错误的；并且，这个错误，还会影响你们计算接触这个外星智能在你们空间的准确位置。我相信，这个接触将发生在澳大利亚。
Space travel, in your terms, will develop in a seemingly extravagant and startling fashion, only to be dumped as such when your scientists discover that space as you know it is a distortion, and that journeying from one so-called galaxy to another is done by divesting the physical body from camouflage.The vehicle of so-called space travel is mental and psychic mobility, in terms of psychic transformation of energy, enabling spontaneous and instantaneous mobility through the spacious present.你们说的太空旅行，将会以一种看似夸张和惊人的方式发展，只是当你们的科学家发现，你们所知道的空间是扭曲的，并且发现，所谓的从一个星系到另一个星系的旅行，是要卸下肉身的伪装才能做到的时候，它就会被丢弃。所谓太空旅行的载具是精神和灵性的移动(mobility)，就灵性的能量转换而言，能够在广阔的现在，自发和瞬间的移动。
As to the means, the very simplest and crudest but still to be adopted method will prove to be hypnotism, simply because at this point your personalities will not trust their own abilities but must rely upon suggestion from the outside.至于手段，最简单、最粗略，但仍然会被采用的方法，将被证明是催眠，只因为此时，你们的人格不会信任自己的能力，而必须依靠外界的暗示。
I hope to try with you methods of energy transference divorced from or divested from hypnotism as such.This will be one of our experiments together and will not be too far in the future.When the time comes we three will try together.In the meantime preparation includes a systematic and scheduled use of psychological time.我希望和你们一起尝试完全不用催眠的能量转换方法。这将会是我们共同的实验之一，而且是在不远的将来。到时候我们三个一起试。同时准备工作包括有系统、有计划地运用心理时间。
Hypnotism will be used scientifically simply as a means of breaking down the inhibitions of the outer personality.It goes without saying that such inhibitions are necessary on your plane, and any experiments that we try will be carried on in a most disciplined fashion.催眠将会在科学上，单纯地被当作打破外在人格种种抑制的手段。不言而喻，这些抑制在你们层面上是必要的，我们所做的任何实验，都将以最严谨的方式进行。
I will never either suggest or condone a wholesale letting go of outer personality defenses.I am attempting to build up your outer personalities in their dealings with the outside world, while at the same time teaching the inner self spontaneity and freedom.This is quite a project.我永远不会建议或纵容全盘抛掉外在人格的防御。我正在试图健全你们的外在人格，增强它们处理外在世界的能力，同时，教导内在自己的自发和自由。这是个相当大的工程。
The outer personality must be a strong yet resilient framework, able to dispense with its boundaries and allow the inner self its freedom, and yet strong enough to spring back and maintain its control over outward experience.This is certainly a discipline.外在人格必须是一个强大而又有弹性的架构，能够放掉它的界限，给内在自己自由，但又有足够的力量回弹，并保持对外在经验的控制。这当然是一种锻练。

Hypnotism is important merely as a tool to release the conscious personality from the camouflage inhibitions.It then allows knowledge to rise up.In ordinary circumstances the conscious self deals mainly with camouflage existence.This is after all primarily its purpose.催眠术的重要意义只是作为一种工具，将意识人格从伪装抑制中释放出来。在那之后，知识才得以升起。在一般情况下，有意识的自己主要是在处理伪装的存在。毕竟这是它的首要目的。
However, when it is enabled to let go its preoccupation with the camouflage universe, it can receive and be aware of data received by the inner senses.Such data does not have to be retained on a subconscious level.The conscious personality can be trained to receive, interpret and retain such knowledge.Otherwise such knowledge would be relatively without value in your camouflage universe.不过，当它能够放下对伪装宇宙的专注时，它就能接收并意识到内在感官所接收的资料。这样的资料不一定要被保留在潜意识层。有意识的人格可以被训练去接受、转译和保留这样的知识。否则，这样的知识在你们的伪装宇宙，相对来说就没有价值。
Hypnotism then is one tool to enable the conscious personality to divest itself of its concentrated focus upon outer camouflage, and to enable it to focus instead upon the inner self.The main rule here is merely a change of focus.Knowledge of the basic universe can be achieved, interpreted and retained by your scientists in ways that I will at first outline, and then cover more completely.所以，催眠就是一种工具，它可以使有意识的人格摆脱对外在伪装的集中关注，转而聚焦在内在自己。这里的主要规则就是改变焦点。基本宇宙的知识可以被你们的科学家取得、转译和保有，至于方法，我将首先概述这些方法，然后再更全面地介绍。
Hypnotism is a safer method to begin with than drugs, but hypnotism itself is not necessary if there is an inner willingness to explore the inner universe.The main barrier is the ego’s fear of being subjugated, even as it fears subjugation imagined in death.If the ego can be made to understand that inner awareness, exploration and investigation will actually enlarge its scope of awareness there will be little difficulty.催眠是一种比药物更安全的方法，但是，如果有个内在意愿，想去探索内在宇宙的话，催眠本身就不必要了。主要的障碍是自我对被征服的恐惧，甚至就像，在想象中的死亡中，被征服一样。如果能让自我了解，内在的觉察、探索和调查，实际上会扩大它的觉察范围，就不会有什么困难了。
It may be necessary in the beginning to induce more or less complete amnesia, but this should be avoided.Through constant practice with hypnotism your scientists will discover that it is possible, and definitely beneficial, to allow the conscious ego to retain its memory.Since there is no real division between the ego and the subconscious, the knowledge of the ego and the knowledge of the subconscious are merged in any case.But to be truly effective there should be no attempt to hide subconscious knowledge from the ego.在开始时，可能有必要诱发或多或少的完全失忆，但应该避免这样做。通过对催眠的不断练习，你们的科学家们会发现，让有意识的自我保留它的记忆是可能的，而且绝对是有益的。由于在自我和潜意识之间并没有真正的分隔，所以自我的知识和潜意识的知识，在任何情况下都是融合的。但要达到真正的效果，就不应该企图隐藏潜意识的知识，不让自我知道。
I realize that hypnotism will be utilized first.Nevertheless progress could be quickened if persons who did not need hypnotism to divest themselves of outer focus were used in scientific experiments.我明白催眠将会先被利用。然而在科学实验里，如果选用不需要利用催眠就可以摆脱外在焦点的人，进度就可以加快。
With practice the personal distortive layers of subconscious material could be recognized without difficulty, and even these will give you valuable insights into psychological mechanisms.经由练习，就可以不难识别个人的潜意识资料的扭曲层，甚至，这些还会让你们对心理机制有珍贵的深入了解。
Telepathy involves of course a focusing of abilities and energy.The trouble is that when you are dealing with, say, the transmission of a picture, you are still dealing with camouflage.You will do better when you focus inwardly in a receptive manner, but without any inhibiting factor.That is when you are willing to receive whatever comes.Focusing upon a camouflage objective will give you a camouflage result.心灵感应当然涉及到能力和能量的聚焦。麻烦的是，当你面对的是，比如说，图片的传输，你面对的还是伪装。当你以一种接受性的方式向内聚焦，但没有任何抑制因素时，你们会做得更好。那就是不管传来什么，你们都愿意接收。聚焦在伪装的目标，得到的也会是伪装的结果。
You must be more open and receptive than this in order to receive knowledge of undistorted basic realities.And the truly hilarious part of this is that such seemingly subjective data will enable you to cut through objective, or so-called objective, reality in a way that will give you so-called proofs, that you can achieve in no other fashion.你必须要比这更开放、更乐意接受，才能接收到没有扭曲的基本实相的知识。而真正搞笑的是，这种看似主观的资料，却能让你们能够以一种方式切入客观，或所谓的客观实相，给你带来所谓的证明，而这是你们无法用其他方式实现的。
